你班撚樣，日日話外國冇人理香港，明明德國就勁多人關注香港

在德港人係德國搞左好多次集會，好多德國報紙都有報，仲令好多德媒出文去深入探討香港而家發生既事，更由此引德國人反思好多問題，令德國人知香港既事係關佢地事架！

係8.17（8.18前夕）同8.31，呢班在德港人都有係漢堡舉行集會聲援香港。係8.17漢堡集會入面，有班中國撚樣都有黎拆場搞事，影人大頭，恐嚇D集會人士要將Ｄ相比中國在德領事館，令中共有曬record，唔比Ｄ在德港人番香港。

不過佢地好快就柒撚左啦，因為佢地一出中國國旗，德國既真警察就話班中國撚樣係度非法集會，仲收撚走佢地枝國旗第二日德國仲有勁多報紙報呢個集會，甚至開始搵Ｄ出名既在德港人做專訪，出左好多關於香港既專題，令多左德國人知香港既事！

German Newspaper Articles on the “Save Hong Kong”-Protests in Hamburg, Germany

Why are Hongkongers in Hamburg, Germany, afraid of protesting?
Original article: “Warum Hongkonger in Hamburg Angst vor dem Protestieren haben” https://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/hongkong-hamburg-protest-1.4580538 (August 30th, 2019) by Peter Burghardt (Hamburg, Germany) and Lea Deuber (Beijing, China)
TLDR:
● Hongkongers living in Hamburg are protesting to show solidarity with the people in their hometown who fight for the special status of Hong Kong and against Chinese influence.
● During the last rally, Beijing loyal Chinese disturbed the assembly, photographed participants and threatened them.
● The protesters suspect the central government in Beijing to orchestrate the counter-protests. Nevertheless, they are going to protest again on the upcoming Saturday (August 31st, 2019).
● The upcoming protest in Hong Kong on the same day has been banned and leading activists have been arrested.
Summary of the Article:
On the upcoming Saturday, August 31st, a group of young Hongkongers is organizing their second rally in Hamburg where they are going to protest peacefully to raise awareness for the protests in Hong Kong fighting for freedom, human rights and democracy. They will meet at the Jungfernstieg, a popular and crowded place. For symbolic reasons they will dress in black shirts and wear surgical masks as well as eye patches.
Meanwhile, the situation in Hong Kong is menacing. Chinese troops are waiting close to the border, while protesters in the city getting beaten up by police and thugs. Additionally the protests on August 31st have been banned in Hong Kong and important figures in this pro-democracy movement including Agnes Chow and Joshua Wong have been arrested, sharing the fate of a total of 900 protesters which also were taken into custody.
Surprisingly, the protesters in Germany also encounter threatening situations especially in the context of the last demonstration on August 17th in front of the town hall which was properly registered with the police, like all events of the group. Some participants received threats like “I hope your whole family dies!” on social media. During the rally Beijing-loyal counter-protesters tried to disturb the assembly. They acted highly organized and aggressive and unsuccessfully tried to provoke the protesters by shouting, insulting, singing the Chinese anthem and showing big Chinese flags. Furthermore, they filmed/photographed individual participants and threatened to send the pictures/videos to the Chinese consulate which can be understood as a definite threat in the age of automatic facial recognition technology. Some participants suspect the Chinese government to organize the counter-protests. All in all, this reminds of similar incidents in Canada or Australia, where the government is now even investigating how far universities are undermined by China.
At the same time, the protesters warn against China's influence in Germany and all of Europe knowing of the economic importance of this connection. Recently, a delegation led by the mayor of Hamburg visited Shanghai but did not discuss the issue of human rights. The protesters demand a critical evaluation of investments in China or the sale of companies to Chinese entities. Additionally, the participants call for more engagement from the German society and government.

The Wall of Silence
Original article: “Die Mauer des Schweigens” https://www.zeit.de/hamburg/2019-08/proteste-hongkong-china-heimat-demonstration-anfeindungen (paywall, August 27th, 2019) by Annika Lasarzik (Hamburg, Germany)
TLDR:
● A rally by young Hongkongers and their supporters was disturbed by Beijing-loyal counter-protesters. The police had to intervene on multiple occasions.
● Some participants received threats and had their photos taken by Chinese counter-protesters which could send them to the Chinese government.
● Pro-Hong-Kong protesters feel threatened albeit being far from home.
● The Chinese Consulate General in Hamburg, Germany released a statement claiming that they did not organize the counter-protest but that it could understand the demand for such a movement asking the German authorities to respect and protect the rights and interests of Chinese citizens.
● The democracy movement is well aware of the important economic ties between Germany and China. However they demand to reevaluate the relations with the country.
Summary of the Article:
On August 17th, 2019 3pm a group of 40 young people organized a protest under the slogan “Save Hong Kong” in front of the town hall of Hamburg, Germany supporting the democracy movement in Hong Kong. For symbolic reasons they wear dark clothes and surgical masks. After 10 minutes, around 50 Beijing-loyal counter-protesters arrive and start to disturb the event. The atmosphere is tense and the counter-protesters try to escalate the situation by showing two big China flags and by tearing down the mask of a young woman. The German police has to separate the two groups on two occasions. The meticulous documentation by the police confirms the aggressive and provocative behavior of the Chinese counter-protesters. All in all, the situation is reminiscent of similar clashes in Australia, Canada and the USA.
The group that organized the demonstration, is going to hold another rally on August 31st at Hamburgs popular Jungfernstieg. The group consists mostly of young people, all with different backgrounds. Most of them are Hongkongers, others have different connections to this special administrative region in China. They organize mostly on social media, including Facebook, Reddit and Telegram.
A young woman from Hong Kong who lives in Hamburg for a long time reports that she used to be rather unpolitical but that the current protests changed that leading her to partake. Unfortunately, a photo of her were she briefly removed her mask appeared in a Chinese WeeChat group and she received a threat that it would be sent to the Chinese consulate. Even though she did nothing wrong and despite living so far away from China, she is a bit frightened as she does not know how the Chinese might act towards her in the future. Furthermore, she received an insult “I hope you and your whole family dies” so that she had to file criminal charges twice.
The Consulate General of China in Hamburg released a statement, stating that it would be understandable that Chinese students and other Chinese living in Germany want to express their outrage at the deeds of the protesters in Hong Kong. At the same time, the consulate states that it did not organize the counter-protest or encourage its citizens to partake in such a movement and that the Chinese should obey the local German law. On the other hand, the consulate asks Germany to protect the rights and interests of Chinese in Germany.
The Hongkongers are well aware of the important economic ties between Germany and China. For example, 550 Chinese companies have offices in Hamburg and 10000 Chinese live in the city. The harbor is an important trade hub for Chinese goods in Europe and would be an important part in China’s new silk road project. Still the protesters demand more engagement of the German government and society as well as the reevaluation of the relations to China.

為香港自由努力的年青人，你們並不孤單也不應放棄生命，帶着烈士的遺志將恨化作愛留存力量。
你無需感到灰心自責。只要你有勇氣踏出一步，世界仍然很大有容納我們之處。

在德港人係德國搞左好多次集會，好多德國報紙都有報，仲令好多德媒出文去深入探討香港而家發生既事，更由此引德國人反思好多問題，令德國人知香港既事係關佢地事架！

你班撚樣，日日話外國冇人理香港，明明德國就勁多人關注香港

在德港人係德國搞左好多次集會，好多德國報紙都有報，仲令好多德媒出文去深入探討香港而家發生既事，更由此引德國人反思好多問題，令德國人知香港既事係關佢地事架！

係8.17（8.18前夕）同8.31，呢班在德港人都有係漢堡舉行集會聲援香港。係8.17漢堡集會入面，有班中國撚樣都有黎拆場搞事，影人大頭，恐嚇D集會人士要將Ｄ相比中國在德領事館，令中共有曬record，唔比Ｄ在德港人番香港。

不過佢地好快就柒撚左啦，因為佢地一出中國國旗，德國既真警察就話班中國撚樣係度非法集會，仲收撚走佢地枝國旗第二日德國仲有勁多報紙報呢個集會，甚至開始搵Ｄ出名既在德港人做專訪，出左好多關於香港既專題，令多左德國人知香港既事！
